column4: Good morning. I am looking for finding the device file for Bluetooth in /dev, but failed to do so so far. I would like to use Bluetooth under wine, but for that I would like to know which device file I have to link. It's not rfcomm*, I am already through that part.
I think it's a different part of /dev for different kinds of bluetooth devices
Well, sure, but since I am clueless where to look, some advice would be welcome.
for example, a mouse or keyboard would be something like hid, whereas headset would be something like audio
Right now I have a phone added as Bluetooth device, and would like to use COM transfer
Yet I don't see anything which might point as being available for such
yeah, I'm not sure where that would show up, but it does seem that /dev is this most likely place. lemme check
Sure, thank you...
/dev let me down unfortunetaly... :(
com transfer as in a remote control?
Yes, would like to make possible running a phone-handling application running
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BluetoothDialup This helped me a bit, but since the description is rather very old I thought there might be other solutions too...
did you check the bluetoothremotecontrol page?
Since I doubt this has been left as it is...
Not yet, but the weird thing is, that I AM able to remote control my desktop through the phone WITHOUT any tricks
So this is why I doubt I would need to hack /etc/bluetooth, and there must be a dev present in /dev
But I might be still wrong
I think you would need to edit that to change functionality, but I'm not sure how to, sorry
Oh well, thank you anyway for trying...
Appearntly ffmpeg might be able handling it. So I guess having that and playing it under Totem might do the trick
or vlc ;)
